Essence.definition: the real or ultimate nature of a thing
Essence.origin: [his award is legitimate only so long as it draws its from the collective bargaining agreement " United Steel Workers v. Enterprise Wheel and Car Corp. , 363 U.S. 593 (1960)"]

1.definition: the real or ultimate nature of a thingthe properties that make a thing what it is [his award is legitimate only so long as it draws its from the collective bargaining agreement ", 363 U.S. 593 (1960)"] see also

2.definition: the predominant purpose of a thing [the of the contract]
